frameDefinitions: In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
A Creator  produces a physical object which is to serve as a Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event, the Represented.
A  Source_of_authority, typically a government, relies upon a set of institutions specialized for the administration of justice.
In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '
A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.
The words in this frame describe motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver.
frameExamples: Epstein saw the machine-man and <t>carved</t> him in shiny metal.
The federal <t>judiciary</t>'s certification process is the foundation of the interpreter program. INI DNI
The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
I <t>sent</t> the manuscript to England to Bill.
Tim <t>drove</t> his car all the way across North America.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
The entity--which may be a thing, an action or a state--that is represented by the <fen>Representation</fen>.
The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
The location in which the artist produces the representation.
A permanent organization with the socially important purpose of administering justice.
The concern of the <fen>Judicial_body</fen>-- broadly speaking, the aspect of society that they affect.

The responsibility that a <fen>Judicial_body</fen> has, either defined in terms of the type of cases that they can hear, or more specifically by reference to an action that the authority constituting them wishes the <fen>Judicial_body</fen>  to achieve.
The geographical area within which the <fen>Judicial_body</fen> has authority and responsibility.
The place where the <fen>Judicial_body</fen> is located.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
This is the person who initiates the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.

The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
I <t>sent</t> the logs <fex name='Goal'>to the shed</fex>.

The objects being sent.
I mailed <fex name='Theme'>the books</fex> <fex name='Goal'>to Alaska</fex>.
Note that <fen>Theme</fen> may be multiply instantiated.
They <t>mailed</t><fex name='Theme'>a questionnaire</fex> <fex name='Theme'>with a return envelope</fex>.

The mode of sending employed.
I <t>shipped</t> <fex name='Theme'>the crops</fex> <fex name='Transport_means'>by bigrig </fex>.

This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fex name='Sender'>Tess</fex> <t>mailed</t> <fex name='Theme'>a letter</fex> <fex name='Recipient'> to Abby</fex>
When the sending takes place
A spatial setting encomnpassing the Source location, where the Sending event takes place.
This is the being, typically human, that controls the <fen>Vehicle</fen> as it moves.
This is the means of conveyance controlled by the <fen>Driver</fen>.  It may move in any way or medium.  With verbs, <fen>Vehicle</fen> is usually expressed as Object:

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.

Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>. This includes directional expressions and 'middle of path'' expressions, e.g.:

Any expression which tells where the moving object(s) ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>. Some particles imply the existence of a <fen>Goal</fen> which is understood in the context of utterance.

This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Locative setting adjuncts of motion expressions may also be assigned this frame element.
The  <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Driver</fen> operates the <fen>Vehicle</fen>
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location of a more specific motion (which has <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>).
listRoleExamples: <fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
<fex>'I'd like an extension,'</fex> begged Pat.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
I urged him to concede <fex>yesterday</fex>.
Since <fex>Frans</fex> photographed them ten years ago the population has increased.
When Nadar photographed <fex>her</fex>, Desbordes-Valmore was sixty-eight.
I drew him <fex>at work</fex> a bunch of times, mainly for the amusement of the staff.
The International Monetary Fund Administrative <fex><t>Tribunal</t></fex> (IMFAT) adjudicates employment disputes between staff members and the IMF.

Anything you say or write can and will be held against you in
a court <fex>of law</fex>.
The International Criminal Tribunal <fex>for Rwanda</fex> sentenced Mikaeli Muhimana on April 28 to life imprisonment.
On February 18, 1983, the Supreme Court <fex>of Alabama</fex> denied this motion.
I sent the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>.
Barney posted the letter on Monday <fex>in Athens</fex>
<fex>Kim</fex> drove my old car cross-country.
I drove <fex>my car</fex> to Canada.
Kim drove <fex>out of town</fex>.
The bikers rode <fex>through the desert</fex>.
Kim drove <fex>into the parking lot</fex>.
The bikers rode <fex>all over the place</fex>.
<fex>Yesterday</fex>, Smithers paddled his boat across the lake and back
